items.label: assumption-regularity-summary
items.title: Summary of Regularity Assumptions
items.content:
761: :label: assumption-regularity-summary
762: 
763: The well-posedness of the coupled mean-field system relies on the following assumptions, which are satisfied by the Canonical Euclidean Gas:
764: *   **(H1)** The domains $X_{\text{valid}}$ and $V_{\text{alg}}$ that comprise the phase space {prf:ref}`def-mean-field-phase-space` are bounded and have smooth ($C^2$) boundaries.
765: *   **(H2)** The reward potential $R_{\text{pos}}$ is $C^2$, making the force field $F$ globally Lipschitz.
766: *   **(H3)** The flow field $u$ is $C^1$, and all physical parameters ($m, \gamma_{\text{fric}}, \Theta, \sigma_x$) are finite and positive.
767: *   **(H4)** All algorithmic functions (e.g., the rescale function, companion selection) are measurable and satisfy the continuity properties established in the abstract framework.
items.section: ## 4. Analysis and Properties of the Mean-Field Equations
items.raw_directive:
758: The rigorous analysis of the coupled mean-field system—proving the existence, uniqueness, and long-term behavior of its solutions—requires a set of standing technical assumptions on the regularity of its constituent parts.
759: 
760: :::{prf:assumption} Summary of Regularity Assumptions
761: :label: assumption-regularity-summary
762: 
763: The well-posedness of the coupled mean-field system relies on the following assumptions, which are satisfied by the Canonical Euclidean Gas:
764: *   **(H1)** The domains $X_{\text{valid}}$ and $V_{\text{alg}}$ that comprise the phase space {prf:ref}`def-mean-field-phase-space` are bounded and have smooth ($C^2$) boundaries.
765: *   **(H2)** The reward potential $R_{\text{pos}}$ is $C^2$, making the force field $F$ globally Lipschitz.
766: *   **(H3)** The flow field $u$ is $C^1$, and all physical parameters ($m, \gamma_{\text{fric}}, \Theta, \sigma_x$) are finite and positive.
767: *   **(H4)** All algorithmic functions (e.g., the rescale function, companion selection) are measurable and satisfy the continuity properties established in the abstract framework.
768: *   **(H5)** The killing rate function $c(z)$ is smooth ($C^\infty$), non-negative, and has compact support in a neighborhood of $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$.

items.label: assumption-domain-regularity
items.title: Regularity of the Valid Domain
items.content:
803: :label: assumption-domain-regularity
804: 
805: The valid position domain $X_{\text{valid}} \subset \mathbb{R}^d$ (from the phase space {prf:ref}`def-mean-field-phase-space`) satisfies:
806: 
807: 1. **Smoothness**: $X_{\text{valid}}$ is an open, bounded domain with $C^3$ boundary $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$.
808: 2. **Distance Function**: The signed distance function $d(x) := \text{dist}(x, \partial X_{\text{valid}})$ is $C^2$ in a tubular neighborhood $\mathcal{T}_\delta := \{x \in X_{\text{valid}} : d(x) < \delta\}$ for some $\delta > 0$.
items.section: ## 4. Analysis and Properties of the Mean-Field Equations
items.raw_directive:
800: We work with the following precise geometric and regularity framework:
801: 
802: :::{prf:assumption} Regularity of the Valid Domain
803: :label: assumption-domain-regularity
804: 
805: The valid position domain $X_{\text{valid}} \subset \mathbb{R}^d$ (from the phase space {prf:ref}`def-mean-field-phase-space`) satisfies:
806: 
807: 1. **Smoothness**: $X_{\text{valid}}$ is an open, bounded domain with $C^3$ boundary $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$.
808: 2. **Distance Function**: The signed distance function $d(x) := \text{dist}(x, \partial X_{\text{valid}})$ is $C^2$ in a tubular neighborhood $\mathcal{T}_\delta := \{x \in X_{\text{valid}} : d(x) < \delta\}$ for some $\delta > 0$.
809: 3. **Unit Inward Normal**: For each $x \in \mathcal{T}_\delta$, let $n_x(x) = -\nabla d(x)$ denote the unit inward normal vector (pointing into $X_{\text{valid}}$).

items.title: Regularity of the Discrete Integrator
items.content:
814: :label: assumption-integrator-regularity
815: 
816: The discrete kinetic integrator (see {prf:ref}`def-baoab-update-rule`) produces position updates of the form:
817: 
818: $$
819: x^+(\tau; x,v) = x + v\tau + \frac{\tau^2}{2m}F(x) + R_{\text{pos}}(\tau; x,v)
820: $$

items.content:
826: :label: assumption-density-regularity-killing
827: 
828: The phase-space density $f^\tau(x,v)$ (see {prf:ref}`def-phase-space-density`) at the start of a discrete timestep satisfies:
829: 
830: 1. **Boundedness**: $\|f^\tau\|_{L^\infty(\Omega)} \le M_f$ for some $M_f > 0$.
